abstract: The opening of Time Warner Cable shares on the public market faces yet another delay after a federal judge on Wednesday blocked Adelphia Communications, the cable television company, from moving ahead with its $15 billion plan to emerge from bankruptcy protection. The judge granted a request by an 11-member bondholder group, which includes Lehman Brothers and Bank of America, to appeal the Jan. 3 order approving the reorganization plan which they say undervalues their claims.
